isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 5 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER ES43-5 AND ES53-5 - REASSEMBLY - CASE

step1.para: Wearing safety glasses, press the bearing onto the main drive gear ( Figure 61). Secure it with a snap ring. Position the oil slinger, then lightly press it into place by tapping it with a brass hammer. This will keep oil in the pocket bearing and help prevent component damage.

figure.caption: Figure 61. Press Bearing onto Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Place the input shaft subassembly into the clutch housing ( Figure 62). Tap it into place with a rubber mallet.

figure.caption: Figure 62. Place Input Shaft Subassembly into Clutch Housing

step1.para: Place the protective sleeve over the shaft ( Figure 63) to prevent oil seal damage during installation ( Figure 64). Next, coat the input bearing cap with purple Loctite 515® or the equivalent. Install the input bearing cap, making sure the oil return slot in the cap lines up with the oil hole in the clutch housing.

figure.caption: Figure 63. Place Protective Sleeve Over Shaft
Figure 64. Sleeve Prevents Oil Seal Damage During Installation

caution.para: Red sleeve must be used to prevent serious damage to oil seal when assembling bearing cap. Failure to comply will void seal warranty.

step1.para: Tighten the input shaft bearing cap bolts to 25 to 41 ft-lbs. (34 to 56 N•m) ( Figure 65). Remove the protective shaft sleeve now.

figure.caption: Figure 65. Tighten Input Shaft Bearing Cap Bolts

step1.para: Place the 4th-5th speed synchronizer and fork assembly onto the input shaft ( Figure 66).

figure.caption: Figure 66. Place 4th-5th Speed Synchronizer and Fork Assembly onto Input Shaft

step1.para: If you replaced the countershaft front bearing race, lubricate it with Moly #2 grease now. Then set the countershaft subassembly in the clutch housing ( Figure 67).

figure.caption: Figure 67. Set Countershaft Subassembly in Clutch Housing

step1.para: Engage the 4th-5th synchronizer into 5th gear ( Figure 68).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Engage 4th-5th Synchronizer into 5th Gear

step1.para: Align the 4th-5th speed clutch gear splines with the 4th speed gear clutching teeth ( Figure 69). Keeping them aligned when you lower the mainshaft subassembly into place will make installation easier and will help prevent pocket bearing damage.

figure.caption: Figure 69. Align 4th-5th Speed Clutch Gear Splines

step1.para: Install 2nd-3rd speed shift fork assembly onto the mainshaft assembly ( Figure 70). Then, using a chain hoist, lift the mainshaft subassembly into position.

figure.caption: Figure 70. Install 2nd-3rd Speed Shift Fork Assembly onto Mainshaft Assembly

step1.para: Install the 1st-reverse clutch gear and fork assembly ( Figure 71).

figure.caption: Figure 71. Install 1st-Reverse Clutch Gear and Fork Assembly

step1.para: Install the lubricated caged needle bearing, reverse gear, and a lubricated thrust washer (flat side against reverse gear) ( Figure 72). Shift all forks to neutral.

figure.caption: Figure 72. Install Reverse Gear

step1.para: Place the rear shift bar support bracket into position before lowering the case over the gear assembly ( Figure 73); otherwise, the case might not fit into place, or the unit will not shift properly.

figure.caption: Figure 73. Place Rear Shift Bar Support Bracket into Position

step1.para: Lubricate the reverse idler gear caged needle bearings and spacer with Moly #2 grease. Place the bearing, spacer, and bearing into the reverse idler gear. Install the gear into the housing with the longer hub facing the clutch housing ( Figure 74).

figure.caption: Figure 74. Install Reverse Idler Gear

step1.para: Next use a rubber mallet to tap the reverse idler shaft into place. The shaft notch should align with the bearing cap hole shown in Figure 75. The notch in the shaft should be just below the case surface when installed correctly.

figure.caption: Figure 75. Shaft Notch Should Align With Bearing Cap Hole

step1.para: Set the countershaft rear bearing cap into place without securing it ( Figure 76). The cap bolt holes should align with the bolt holes in the transmission case. If they don't, recheck the reverse idler shaft to make sure it is aligned properly and is tapped down far enough.

figure.caption: Figure 76. Set Countershaft Rear Bearing Cap into Place

step1.para: Make sure the two dowel pins are in place on the clutch housing ( Figure 77). They should extend above the clutch housing no more than 1/4". Then install the case. Secure it with bolts tightened to 25 to 41 ft-lbs. (34 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 77. Make Sure Dowel Pins Are in Place

step1.para: Coat the rear countershaft bearing race with Moly #2 grease ( Figure 78). Install it with a suitable driver. Install the shims.

figure.caption: Figure 78. Coat Rear Countershaft Bearing Race with Moly #2 Grease

step1.para: Install the output shaft bearing next ( Figure 79). Use a suitable driver.

figure.caption: Figure 79. Install Output Shaft Bearing

step1.para: Secure the countershaft rear bearing cap snugly into place with at least two bolts ( Figure 80). Do not seal the cap yet.

figure.caption: Figure 80. Secure Countershaft Rear Bearing Cap into Place

step1.para: Now check countershaft end play through the PTO opening by gently lifting up on a countershaft gear ( Figure 81). End play must be set between .001 to .008 inch (.025 to .203 mm). If it isn't correct, make adjustments by either adding or removing shims under the countershaft rear bearing cap.

figure.caption: Figure 81. Check Countershaft End Play

step1.para: When finished, coat the PTO opening cover with purple Loctite 515® or the equivalent ( Figure 82). Install the cover and tighten to 25 to 41 ft-lbs. (34 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 82. Install PTO Opening Cover

step1.para: Apply purple Loctite 515® or the equivalent to the countershaft rear bearing cap ( Figure 83). Tighten the bolts to 25 to 41 ft-lbs. (34 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 83. Apply Loctite to Countershaft Rear Bearing Cap

step1.para: Notice that there are two spacers under the lift hook ( Figure 84). These allow the hook to extend above the lip of the bearing cap.

figure.caption: Figure 84. Two Spacers Are Under Lift Hook

step1.para: Install the speedometer gear ( Figure 85).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Install Speedometer Gear

step1.para: Install the gasket and rear bearing cap ( Figure 86). Tighten the bolts to 25 to 41 ft-lbs. (34 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 86. Install Gasket and Rear Bearing Cap

step1.para: Coat the rear shift bar support cap with Purple Loctite 515® or the equivalent. Then install a long bracket bolt in one end of the rear shift bar support bracket. Lift up on it to raise the bracket to its proper position. Hold it while attaching the rear shift bar support cap to the other end of the bracket ( Figure 87).

figure.caption: Figure 87. Attach Rear Shift Bar Support Cap

step1.para: Remove the first rear shift bar support bracket bolt. Secure the other end of the shift bar support cap to the bracket using the bolt you just removed ( Figure 88). Secure the support cap using the remaining four shorter bolts. Tighten the bolts to 25 to 41 ft-lbs. (34 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Secure Other End of Shift Bar Support Cap to Bracket

step1.para: Attach the end fitting, washer, and nut ( Figure 89). Tighten to 300 to 325 ft-lbs. (407 to 441 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Attach End Fitting, Washer, and Nut

step1.para: Use a chain hoist to lower the transmission onto the bench ( Figure 90). Bench shift the unit to make sure it is working properly.

figure.caption: Figure 90. Lower Transmission onto Bench

step1.para: Install the backup light switch ( Figure 91). Tighten it to 40 ft-lbs. (54 N•m). Install the three poppets and poppet springs now.

figure.caption: Figure 91. Install Backup Light Switch

step1.para: Install the gasket and retaining plate ( Figure 92). The two detents on the plate must fit over the two poppet springs. This helps ensure proper tension on the shift bar. Secure with bolts tightened to 25 to 41 ft-lbs. (34 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 92. Install Gasket and Retaining Plate

step1.para: Install the interlock ( Figure 93). Reassembly is complete.

figure.caption: Figure 93. Install Interlock
